comments.body: Why `test_release_1_1`? Do you plan to rename this to `release_1_1` later?

oh I see now that you are generating this for testdata.
Whats the usecase?
Is it to provide an independent example of generated client?

I dont see the code that calls main with test=true.
Will this be auto-updated anytime someone updates the generator code?

> Whats the usecase?
> Is it to provide an independent example of generated client?

It's for testing the generator actually generates a usable, complete client. Here's the test file: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/cmd/libs/go2idl/client-gen/testoutput/testgroup/unversioned/testgroup_test.go

> Will this be auto-updated anytime someone updates the generator code?

No. hack/verify-codegen.sh will give an error, and the developer needs to manually call client-gen to update the generated clients and these tests.

Needless to say that we should add a script for that.
I am reviewing this PR and I am not sure what command I should be running. Someone who has no idea is going to have a very bad time :)

Ah, sorry I forgot to mention there is a hack/update-codegen.sh that update all the generated code. https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/hack/after-build/run-codegen.sh#L36

As for the end-user, when we release the tool, we'll give them examples so they won't be baffled.
